website_summaries.verdict: A great option for anyone who prefers to cook smaller servings of rice and steamed vegetables, Oster’s 6-Cup Rice Cooker is an inexpensive and reliable kitchen helper.
pros: Removable nonstick inner pot is easy to clean
Features auto shut-off and warming modes
Includes steaming tray, measuring cup, and ladle
cons: While the ability to cook 6 cups of rice is nice, a larger capacity is a better choice for larger families

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and super useful!
customer_reviews.text: Have to say this is absolutely awesome. I bought it at discount price around 18 dollars. And it can be used to cook noodles, make rice, make soup, and even hot pot!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY! WON'T LAST LONGER THAN 6 MONTHS
customer_reviews.text: looks stylish but broke after 5 months of use. My mom was using it to cook rice 2-3 times per week. After 5 months of use, the button to turn it on does not stay down, essentially not able to turn it on anymore. Do yourself a favor... buy something a bit more pricey and it will be worth the money when it lasts for many years. I have a Panasonic ricecooker (small, same size as this Oster one) and it is now 6 YEARS old and is still cooking rice perfectly! I'm going to go back to Panasonic instead.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh2316

customer_reviews.title: It is without a doubt the worst item I have in my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I urge you not to buy this Rice Cooker!!! It is without a doubt the worst item I have in my kitchen. While the rice is cooking it spits liquid all over the counter and on top of all that it burns the rice on the bottom. Now, keep in mind that I gave this product several chances and each time it was a disappointing experience. Buyer Beware!
customer_reviews.author: Annie B

customer_reviews.title: Works great, use it almost every day!
customer_reviews.text: Cooks rice perfectly every time. If you leave it on for a long time after it's done, the rice gets a little brown and crispy at the bottom, but it's still nice to eat in my opinion and easily avoided. I've used this with both long grain white rice and calrose rice and it works great with both. The red is a pretty color and matches my other Oster appliances. I've never used the vegetable steamer feature because I usually make a lot of vegetables with dinner, more than the capacity of the attachment, but cooking vegetables isn't what I bought the product for so I'm not factoring it into my review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No spills. Steam, though.  And, big stepdown in capacity from 4-cup to 3-cup (the precooked measure of this "6 cup" cooker).
customer_reviews.text: This is a good design, though with a tradeoff. The inner pot has a lip that overlaps the exterior, to prevent your boiling goulash from spilling in between. (This is probably what made my worn-out larger (4-cup precooked) rice cooker, a different brand, stop working.) But (tradeoff:) my old one would collect and condense the steam outflow, where this one has a small hole in the top for venting steam. If you're stepping down from a 4-cup cooker, and you liked the amount of food it made, a 3-cup one's capacity will seem very small. (But this one does compensate somewhat by having the steamer, so you could steam vegetables and then mix them in later.)
customer_reviews.author: A. New

customer_reviews.title: Too Small! the 'cups' they advertise are not a full measuring cup
customer_reviews.text: It works ok but it's too small- I had a previous cheapo rice cooker of this type, but it was just slightly larger, and worked perfectly in size for my rice *always* 2 cups dry rice,-3.5 cups water= perfect rice of all types every time. THIS cooker doesn't make 3cups dry/6 cups cooked. my usual 2 cups for rice always overfills it and makes a bit of a mess- and I can't add anything else to make different foods. this is smaller than advertised,as obviously the 'cups' they refer to in this advertisement are not full measure cups. replacing with a slightly larger model. Therefore the 3 stars,if you want very small cooker.
customer_reviews.author: J. murphy

customer_reviews.title: Big disappointment
customer_reviews.text: I had it in storage because our son came to live with us and had what I call a Rolls Royce Zojirushi rice cooker where you could make rice or oatmeal etc. So I have someone coming for lunch and put water and rice and press a button. An hour later still half cooked so I press cook once more and same problem.
customer_reviews.author: Margarita Uricoechea

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC and more than a rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I use this thing almost like a slow-cooker. VERY easy to use, and rice turns out perfect EVERY TIME. Veggie steamer looks like a tacky add on, but it works very very well. I was sort of surprised. There are a couple rice-cooker cookbooks out there that you should buy with this product. I live alone, and it really does make a good appliance for single or double meals. Everything I've tried in it has turned out.
customer_reviews.author: Carl E. Mitchell

customer_reviews.title: Buyers remorse.
customer_reviews.text: I gave away my old cooker because I wanted something a little smaller in the cupboard. I am SO sorry I chose this one. I always had perfect rice before. This one consistently UNDERCOOKS the rice and burns it a little on the bottom. I have adjusted measurements over and over and it never changes. It also always boils out dirty rice water in the start of cooking from the steam hole. This makes it really difficult to clean it. I would absolutely not purchase this cooker. Spend a little more and save yourself the aggravation.
customer_reviews.author: brookie

customer_reviews.title: Great, affordable, & does the job!
customer_reviews.text: This is an adorable rice cooker and it does the job GREAT! With every appliance you'll have to learn just how much water you prefer for your rice, but once you do it's a dream. For me I like stickier rice so I do two Oster cups of jasmine rice and fill the water line to level 3. Comes out just right! Just be sure to turn the hole in the lid so it faces outward to prevent any steam from damaging cabinets, etc. Also it makes enough rice for only 2-3 people so keep that in mind if you're cooking for larger numbers.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I really had high hopes for this rice cooker, especially with the name Oster. Every single batch of rice boiled over or stuck to the bottom of the pan. Btw, I added oil to it as well with one of my batches, and the rice still stuck. I’m not wasting anymore of my time, or rice. I hear the Tiger rice cooker is flawless.
customer_reviews.author: jaime

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a good machine, but it browns the bottom of the rice.
customer_reviews.text: My old rice cooker, even with it's scuffed up rice pan, never burnt the rice. It never even made the bottom brown. This one makes the bottom of the rice brown...very slightly but visibly. It's a "good" rice cooker, but it didn't beat the no name brand that was $15 we got years ago... you know, one of those white ones with the silver lid and black handles...generic. Maybe we'll keep this one...maybe I'll find a kid going off to college and give it away. I'm sure this is a fine rice cooker for a lot of people... I just can't get over the fact that the old one would never burn/brown the rice even a little bit...ever.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: This is great if you are a single person
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect if you are a college student, or single. It literally makes enough rice for one day for two people. It does keep the rice warm, but don't leave in on warm for too long because it keeps cooking the rice and the bottom will become very hard.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the effort.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in April 2017. At first was thrilled with it...we tried different long grain brands and soaked and rinsed all. After 6 months, rice stuck and burned on bottom even after stirring as instructed. Starch spewed out lid and all over counter..we now put a kitchen towel under it..shame because small footprint. Looking for new one on Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Clgmaui

customer_reviews.title: Cheap for a reason
customer_reviews.text: If you aren't certain you'll be using your rice cooker much, definitely get this to give it a try. It's really easy to use and clean. However I do find that, despite following the included instructions, it spits everywhere and sometimes overcooks the rice on the bottom. I still use it, but when it breaks I'll definitely see about spending more money on a better replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Ren Woodard

customer_reviews.title: Great Rice Cooker
customer_reviews.text: I enjoy making rice as a late night snack or just as a part of a dinner or lunch. This rice cooker is my second because my previous one finally died on me, not made by this company, and I finally needed a new one. To my surprise, I can use my other rice cooker's bowl in this one and still make rice perfectly. I am very happy with it and will buy another should my current one die on me.
customer_reviews.author: Janai Jones

customer_reviews.title: My recommendation is to spend a little more and buy a better rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: It is a convenient size for a family of 4 but I believe that it does not always heat evenly. As a result, most times the water comes out and is on the counter top. I put paper towels over it to absorb the water but it still gets messy at times. If you purchase this keep an eye on it at the end and unplug. If you leave it on, it will stay heated at the bottom and teh layer of rice at the bottom gets scorched. Unplugging as soon as the rice is done helps to avoid this. My recommendation is to spend a little more and buy a better rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: V. SInghal

customer_reviews.title: Simple, and works
customer_reviews.text: I don't cook rice often, so a low capacity cooker that I only use every now-and-then seemed like it met my needs. I've used this rice cooker a few times and it works exactly as expected. One thing to note: There are two settings on the front switch, one for warming and one for cooking. There is no off switch. When you plug the cooker into a power outlet, it immediately begins warming, and the light turns on. You have to press the lever down to start actually cooking. The first time I used it, I saw the light on and didn't think to press the switch, and came back 30 minutes later to lukewarm raw rice. Whoops.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Barely works
customer_reviews.text: My old rice cooker stopped working, a burned fuse or something. So I decided to buy a new one. Except to say that it is working would be an overstatement - after I turn it on, after 5 minutes it turns off. None of the rice has been cooked. I cannot turn it back on until the unit has cooled off, which takes anywhere between 5 to 20 minutes. Rinse and repeat until it actually ends up cooking fully. What normally takes mere 20 minutes turns into an hour long endeavor.
customer_reviews.author: Iret

customer_reviews.title: This is a hot item.  I am so glad I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: Ok so after 30 years I have broken down and got me a rice cooker! I really didn't know what all the fuss was about. This little baby cooks rice fast and perfect every time. it comes with a little cup that you measure the rice out in and on the inside of the cooler there are measuring marks to fill your water to. Perfect Rice! It switches to "warm" when it is our of water and just keeps the rice nice and moist and warm for you! Great product and not very expensive. I am impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: and it's the perfect size for just me (I cook 1 cup of ...
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly, and it's the perfect size for just me (I cook 1 cup of dry rice at a time, but this rice cooker could cook 2-3). Also, I LOVE the steam attachment. I use it every time I cook my rice to steam vegetables. Collards, kale, broccoli, and Brussels sprouts all steam quickly and at an even rate. (In fact, they steam quickly enough that you'll want to take them out before the rice is done. This is very simple too--you just have to lift out the steaming tray with the vegetables and then replace the lid so the rice can keep cooking).
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Berry-Huff

customer_reviews.title: Super simple rice cooker - great size
customer_reviews.text: I have a large, high-end rice cooker that I usually use. However, my family was planning an extended roadtrip, and so I wanted a couple of small, light-weight appliances. I bought this inexpensive rice-cooker. It's super basic: plugged in it's either on the warm setting or the cook setting. It doesn't take up very much room, but it makes plenty of rice for a family of 3+. I've continued using it since we came home because it's easy to clean and takes up less room in my cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: LyndonHome

customer_reviews.title: You can now distinguish my rice from grits!
customer_reviews.text: This is a vital kitchen tool for the domestically challenged cook. I've tried several rice cooking techniques to no avail. This cooker turns out perfectly cooked rice - not hard, not soggy, not mushy, no frothy white rice boil over to scrub off your brand new stainless steel stove. No mess and extremely easy to clean. It's basically a crock-pot, so if you have one of those (who doesn't), you already know how this works. It includes a handy measuring cup, rice spatula, steamer bowl and adequate instructions. It doesn't take up too much counter room, but I would recommend storing it when not in use. Overall, extremely happy!
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: Compact & Reliable - Good value
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Not sure what versatility means in the rating feature above. It is just a rice cooker! It's perfect for one or two "rice eaters" - meaning diets where rice is staple. The previous one I owned, very similar, cooked 12 cups of cooked rice - almost twice the capacity. Manual turn off is recommended after about 30 minutes. Otherwise you have to deal with a semi-burnt layer at the bottom, even though the device is on "warm".
customer_reviews.author: TumTum

customer_reviews.title: Returned
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item mainly to steam vegetables, not for the rice cooker. It was very nice looking and if you wanted it for the rice cooker, it would probably have been fine. However, since the main purpose I wanted it for was to steam vegetables, the little top steamer area was very small. It would only hold enough for 2 people at the most.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki R

customer_reviews.title: should not read 6 cups
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few rice cookers and find that this title is misleading. This takes 3 cups of dry rice, not 6 cups. Had I known I would never have purchased it since I used 10 cup cookers in the past. I didn't read the fine print, but don't feel that it should have been such a misleading title; just say 3 cups like other rice cookers say.
customer_reviews.author: Vonkie

customer_reviews.title: Great after you find out the water amount on your own. Directions are lame.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned 3 basic cookers like this in diff sizes. The rice to water ratios in the instructions have been SO far off it's ridiculous. So plan on 2 or 3 batches until you find the right amount of water. The smallest ones never seem to have steamer trays which are a must for me. One tip about steaming vegs while making rice. Never put frozen brussells,broccoli,or others in frozen. They won't be cooked when the rice is done. Run them under hot or warm water in the tray to thaw out first. Once you figure the water out,these things are pretty handy. That's why I have bought 3 over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Neil W

customer_reviews.title: Funny part is
customer_reviews.text: This tiny little rice cooker gets used almost daily! I make queso in it. Heat up soups. Steam veggies. Funny part is, I haven’t actually made rice in it. My favorite use is steaming frozen veggies for my 10 month old. I toss in a handful of frozen mixed veggies when I start to cook dinner. By the time I’m done they are nice and steamed to a good consistency for her.
customer_reviews.author: Mama Dragon

customer_reviews.title: WASTE OF MONEY!!!
customer_reviews.text: I want to return this, it is terrible it keeps turning itself off before the rice is done, I have to turn it back on 3 times in order to get the rice to finish cooking. I also did not know I would be stuck with it, I bought this 45 days ago, I just tried using it 2 days ago for the second time and what a waste I will not buy the replacement from amazon, Walmart here I come.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: After twenty-five years of ruined rice and/or cleaning up the boil-over mess on my gas stove, I finally relented and decided to try a rice cooker. I figured even if it made a mess, it wouldn't be on my stove, and would be easier to clean off the counter. Well, it does not make a mess at all! Not only that, I'm able to steam vegetables at the same time, while cooking the rice perfectly. I love this rice cooker. It is now one of my favorite kitchen appliances.
customer_reviews.author: G. Dixon

customer_reviews.title: A small wonder for economically making rice
customer_reviews.text: I am surprised how often I use this little wonder. It is a heck of alot easier than a pot on the stove. Only thing is I find the 'keep warm' feature is too hot and makes the rice stick at the end of the cycle. So, when it stops I turn it off entirely. Just get the timing right when the rest of the meal is ready and the rice will be hot too. For the price it is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kristie

customer_reviews.title: surprised
customer_reviews.text: I love rice but hated cooking it especialy in summer hot stemy but with this was perfect the first time not cooking over stove put in pot push button YES read directions first then enjoy
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wisnoski

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Used this several times and the rice always comes out perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Karen G

customer_reviews.title: Follow the instructions....
customer_reviews.text: You need follow the instructions to have a good rice, you need put at least one oil tablespoon , you need rinse the rice before put in the rice cooker, and you have to use the cup that coming with the cooker, if you use other, the amount will be different, but again is a really good product
customer_reviews.author: Andres G.

customer_reviews.title: I hate it
customer_reviews.text: I threw out this rice cooker after struggling to get it to cook rice nicely. My rice would always burn on the bottom of the pot. I now cook all of my rice on the stove and it's so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use rice cooker for small parties
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little rice cooker that looks classy and cooks like a dream. Easy operation and includes a vegetable steamer that sits on top of rice cooker. For our family the rice cooker only makes about 5-6 servings, but that is plenty for us. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jack g

customer_reviews.title: rice cooker
customer_reviews.text: I have never been able to cook rice well. I thought that this would be the answer, It is not the rice still sticks and burns to the bottom of the pot and I have tried it several times. each time following the instructions to the t how ever I even tried adding more water to try to do it without the burning but it still does not. But it does have easy clean up and not much trouble washing out the burnt spots. If you are looking for something to make it easy this was not the thing. I don't think I could recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: joe peters

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is my very first rice cooker and I have to say I've never tasted rice so good at home or anyone else's home for that matter. Even though I over filled it with water, it came out great. Made a bit of a mess, but I am on a learning curve. I just want to keep making rice all day with this thing. Yum. This will be used at least every other day.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCrazy

customer_reviews.title: Good for 2-4 people
customer_reviews.text: I really like this rice cooker. It’s only me and my husband so the size is perfect if you have a large family I don’t really think it’s ideal because it’s small, the veggie tray was smaller than I expected but again for just me and my husband it’s a good size.......one thing I don’t recommend is putting the veggie tray in the dish washer.....the only bad thing i have to say is that sometimes the rice gets a little burnt from the bottom
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Functions
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is pretty simple. You pretty much get what you pay for. It's pretty simple to use since there is only two settings. You can steam vegetables which is what I enjoy about this rice cooker. It pretty much does the job for a pretty cheap price. I would reccomend if you dont have a big budget for a rice cooker but still want it ti get the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Jacklyn

customer_reviews.title: Mini in size but great in service...
customer_reviews.text: This is the best little rice cooker I have ever own... I've had mines for years and decided to purchase one for my mother so she won't have to worry about rice on the stove for her and my father...and she loves it... you don't have to watch it at all, just fill it with rice and water, cut it on and forget about it.... the only thing i would say negative about this product is I wish the pot was no-stick.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia Dunn

customer_reviews.title: This super simple and super cheap rice cooker works exactly as ...
customer_reviews.text: This super simple and super cheap rice cooker works exactly as expected. You can get away with about 4 cups uncooked of white rice, especially if you give it a stir before it finishes, even though its "max" capacity is 3 cups uncooked. It also works extremely fast, and its really easy to clean. This replaced my 8 cup uncooked cooker. This works faster(i suspect they have the same wattage, but this has a smaller surface area), and is much easier to clean. I'm really happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reichert

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect little rice cooker for my needs. It has a warm setting and cook setting. It will remain on the cook setting until all steam has left the pot. Then it kicks over to the warm setting, so you still want to make sure you're paying attention, so that you don't burn your rice. I love the steam basket, lets me cook my whole meal at once if I'm having a lazy day.
customer_reviews.author: S. Campbell

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade from Black & Decker
customer_reviews.text: I prefer this kind of classical rice cookers, not those that look as a smaller pressure cooker. After 4 years of using theit was time to upgrade to a larger cooker, for a larger family. The non stick material is holding fine after 2 months, the lid is well built. The spoon is functional and good quality. Use it or you will eat the teflon. The steamer insert is somehow flimsy and probably made of aluminum. I thought I would just throw it away, but lately I've discovered that steaming a couple of carrots and a little broccoli while cooking rice takes no time nor effort and it is an (almost) complete meal.
customer_reviews.author: martha

customer_reviews.title: I can't cook rice, but now I can.
customer_reviews.text: This little rice cooker has been working great for a couple weeks. I'm terrible at cooking rice. Rice is made effortlessly alongside with steaming your veggies. This is great for a small family, single person, student, or those who like to do some meal prepping for the week. Cleaning is very easy because the steamer basket and rice pot come out easily which appear to be of non-stick material. 5 stars for cost-effective product. It works very well, but isn't made with the best material (kinda cheap, but it's very good).
customer_reviews.author: Alfred

customer_reviews.title: Great Rice Cooker But---
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rice cooker that's easy to use. Add your rice, water, plug it in, push the button down to cook; wait for the pop sound then you have rice. The only NEGATIVE issue I have is that the nonstick only lasted about one or two cycles...sometimes adding butter helps. But clean up is relatively easy, just let it soak for a few hours then the rice that's stuck can easily be scraped off.
customer_reviews.author: JokerBatman

customer_reviews.title: NOT auto shut off
customer_reviews.text: I specifically bought this model because it says on the description that it is Auto Shut off. It stayed on auto warm for more than a day so I finally unplugged it for safety reason. The description for Auto Shutoff is not correct. I don't know when it would've eventually shut off but having it on for hours is not safe.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value, Great product
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised and looks exactly as pictured. I love the price point for this compact little rice cooker. The rice cooks nicely as well and love the rice spatula and steamer basket that comes with it. Haven't tried the steamer tray yet, but the rice cooks perfectly for us every time -- thanks to the opening in the lid which allows for proper steam ventilation. (Our previous rice cooker had an attached/removable lid that ended up trapping the steam and the water would bubble all over the lid and onto the counter. You can imagine the mess.) I hope this product lasts for a while, if not, will definitely purchase again. Overall great value for a great product :)
customer_reviews.author: Fave13

customer_reviews.title: If you lazy and want Dishwasher Safe Product
customer_reviews.text: I used this. My brother uses this and bought his own. If you wish to make Rice a part of your diet and do so in a very straightforward and easy to clean and use method. Look no farther than this product. Can't recommend enough. Don't throw away steam chamber. Very easy to steam vegetables and cook rice at same time.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Works great & Time saving
customer_reviews.text: I really love this thing. It makes multi tasking easier in the kitchen. Makes rice perfect and if you add what ever seasoning and additives it works well that way also. The steamer works well too. I recommend this for any household especially if it’s busy in the kitchen
customer_reviews.author: Medero Clan

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work, right out of the box. (returned.)
customer_reviews.text: The cooker didn't work. It barely got warm after 30 minutes and, didn't get warmer even after a few hours. Returned it for refund. I wouldn't recommend giving it a chance, let alone a second one. Just going to have to spend a little more to get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: DangItDave

customer_reviews.title: Rice cups not US cups
customer_reviews.text: For all rice cookers... For rice measurement, we use a traditional Japanese measure called go or rice cup. A level cup of this measuring cup is 1 rice cup. 1 rice cup equals approximately 3⁄4 US cup or 180 ml. When i received this, the lines in the rice cooker were 1,2,3 "cup" which is a US cup. but it is advertised as a 6 cup cooker. Since all rice cookers seem to use the Japanese standard, multiply by 0.75; 6 x 0.75 = 4.5 US cups of rice. I am returning for a bigger cooker, so not review on cooking ability. I know from experience a small cooker like this will spit water when at limit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't really like it
customer_reviews.text: The directions are poorly written and confusing. It tends to burn the rice. By the time the on button pops up to indicate the rice is done, the rice is already slight burnt.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Bylenga

customer_reviews.title: Switch automatically changes to Warm instead of staying on the Cooking option
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rice cooker with low expectations. All I needed was something tiny with one switch to cook rice -- I didn't expect anything fancy. However, I did expect something to last longer than 15 uses (I don't cook often at all). The "On" switch no longer works. The rice cooker automatically flips back to "Warm". I have to use tape to hold down the switch to actually cook rice. I have no idea how this broke under such light usage. It does its job while it lasts but don't expect it to last longer than three months.
customer_reviews.author: William Ku

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even last 1 year!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rice cooker in May 2017, and it is already malfunctioning. The on switch will not stay on; after holding it for ages and going back and forth, it stays on for a few minutes and then switches back off. I noticed that the on switch had to be held down for a few seconds when I used the rice cooker for the first time, and I thought it was poorly designed. But with the low price, I thought I should not be so picky. But it is ridiculous that the rice cooker didn't even last a year! Very poor quality control!
customer_reviews.author: PetiteBumbleBee

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for two people! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Love this little rice cooker. It is so versatile I can make our rice(which comes out perfect) and the veggies at the same time. It fits nicely on our apt counter or stored easily in my small cabinets. I have had it for more than three months now and use it a lot. It’s not fancy but it works great!
customer_reviews.author: Lalena Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Great little rice cooker!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this rice maker before, but lost it, so I bought the exact same model as a replacement. It steams rice very simply and easily, and it is a snap to clean up when you are finished. This gadget also comes with a little plastic scoop that doesn’t scrape the surface of your machine, as well as a basket to steam veggies at the same time or separately.
customer_reviews.author: christopher m.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect rice every time
customer_reviews.text: We had the same steam rice maker for years and it was always a little sticky every time I used it on the bottom. I wish I had never waited so long to get this rice maker! It's steams vegetables and rice to perfection. We absolutely love it and are using it so much more now because it actually does what it's supposed to do and makes the rice perfectly. It is funny what we will deal with just to avoid change. If you are thinking about getting a new rice maker this is the one you want because it is awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Beachy

customer_reviews.title: no stick ever
customer_reviews.text: I have been very impressed that nothing ever sticks, even my sticky rice. Can't say that about other rice cookers. Hope this company stays around with no changes! everyone in my family who makes rice is getting one for their big stocking stuffer
customer_reviews.author: Colleen

customer_reviews.title: Great Need for kitchen
customer_reviews.text: Oster rice cooker is a must to have for rice, no watching or timing to cover, for stove method especially for the larger amounts needed for some bakes. while rice or pasta is cooking the veggies can be steamed in steamer pot above so all is ready at same time and no watching on stove method.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just like all rice cookers
customer_reviews.text: If youre looking for a cheap rice cooker to serve 4 people or less...this is your pal. I purchased one for myself and another one 6 months later as a gift. Just like all rice cookers, its as plug and play as you can get, makes perfect rice every time and keeps warm thereafter. Downside of this rice cooker is the steam pan and the removable rice bowl, both feel very cheap and thin (because they are), but does not detract from the operation of the cooker. Pro tip: Put a tad more water than necessary when cooking rice for a fluffier rice.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Love its nonstick
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to clean but keep an eye on the time cook! Love its non stick! Not good for seasoned or flavored rice.. it will stick! Great for plain rice and very quickly cooked!
customer_reviews.author: Debbie S.

customer_reviews.title: Don't overfill it
customer_reviews.text: So far there is nothing to dislike. Don't overfill and it won't spill over. Reading other reviews before I purchased it, it wasn't meant to feed a family of five or six. My wife and I find it perfect for two to four. The rice is perfect (add more water) and the steamer works great. Very versatile and cleaning is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: It took me far too long to figure out how to cook rice. And then I got confident and decided I would upgrade to a rice cooker. This one is perfect! I’ll admit I was worried about it when I pulled out of the box, it looked a little cheap, but it’s been great! Can’t wait to try the steamer out!
customer_reviews.author: Snow Rose

customer_reviews.title: Cooked rice good.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and it made good rice. Didn't have any problems with keeping the rice warm and it didn't dry out. The instructions weren't clear as to what the settings mean, had to guess at which was for cooking.
customer_reviews.author: janicemichelle

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't cook well, bottom burns rice,  and rice comes out mushy
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't cook well, bottom burns rice, and rice comes out mushy even if you put the correct rice to water requirement, steamer is useless as well, tried steaming shrimp while rice cooked, shrimp was raw.
customer_reviews.author: Bxbobby

customer_reviews.title: Junk!
customer_reviews.text: This isn't really a steamer. It just boils the rice and even though I put far less water and rice in it that it is purportedly made for, it boils over. You are better off just making your rice in a pot on the stove. At least there you can control the temperature. I have used rice steamers before and this is horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Skydog

customer_reviews.title: Not good enough
customer_reviews.text: This device gets the job done, but has some serious flaws. First, it almost always will form a layer of crust on the bottom which I always discard. Secondly, the unit does not turn off when done, but rather it goes to a "keep warm" setting which, if you leave it too long, will dry out the rice. It does not have the ability to be off while plugged in. Also, it does not have separate settings for different types of rice. And the markings on the inside which denote how much water you should fill are hard to see and should be more clear. All in all I would recommend upgrading to a better product.
customer_reviews.author: andrew tasso

customer_reviews.title: Burns rice and Quinoa, but great for steaming veg
customer_reviews.text: This is great for steaming dumplings and vegetables. For rice, it does turn itself to low, but it also burns the rice or quinoa. There is no On/Off, only On High or On Low. As soon as you plug it in it is On Low. You have to unplug it to turn it Off.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth it !
customer_reviews.text: Many months later and It still working just fine for me. I love being able to steam vegetables as well ! Maybe its a bit small for a family size but great for a few servings of vegetables. Worth it's price !
customer_reviews.author: Miguel Angel Rise

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, simple to use, affordable
customer_reviews.text: I like this rice maker. It is just the right size for storage yet big enough to make enough rice for a family of 4-6 dinner. Put the rice in, add water as per the instructions, press the button and done! In 15 mins or so you'll have delicious rice ready to serve. This is our second rice cooker, the previous one ( same exact type) lasted 5+ years.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: You have to unplug this to turn it off
customer_reviews.text: Yes the warming feature is nice, however it stays on and on and on which eventually becomes dangerous. So you have to unplug the device entirely when you're done with it. We use rice at least 2-5 times a week. So i wish i'd gotten one with an automatic turn off instead. But it cooks perfectly every time. Easy cleanup and small profile for our counter.
customer_reviews.author: Fireflyhaven

customer_reviews.title: Rice Cooker Unsurpassed
customer_reviews.text: "Couldn't be better," says the Filipina cook about the rice cooker. I like the results too.
customer_reviews.author: Carthury

customer_reviews.title: best money you can spend
customer_reviews.text: I have always made rice in a pot or in a bowl in the microwave and always trying to get just the right heat or get just the right length of time in the microwave. Sometimes too dry, sometimes a bit burned on the bottom, sometimes not cooked all the way... Take all that and throw it out the window! After two batches of rice, I found I like about half a notch more of water than they recommend and this has been making perfect rice since. I tried the steaming pan on top filled with vegetables and what another genius discovery. Vegetables came out perfectly cooked. For the money, I just don't see how you can go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: J. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Not a 6 cup rice cooker!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted to replace our small 3 cup rice cooker. The Oster rice cooker is small than our old one. There is no way that this is a 6 cup rice cooker! Very disappointing! It looks great, just not as advertised. Mini rice cooker.
customer_reviews.author: richard/sharon

customer_reviews.title: No more instant rice for us!
customer_reviews.text: I picked this up for my wife for Christmas. We love rice, but while my wife is an EXCELLENT cook (and the 100 lbs. I've put on since we met will speak to that), she has always been intimidated by rice for some reason. This took the intimidation out of it. It's relatively quick, but if you leave it too long, the rice will tend to dry out while it is in "keep warm" mode. All in all, for the price, I don't know if you can beat it. Cleanup is far more simple than what it would appear to be on similar models. It breaks down completely for washing. The removable lid is a must.
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Very bad smell and low quality product
customer_reviews.text: This product has beautiful color and light weighted, that is all the reason I give one star. The product quality is very low. It needs very long time to warm up. If you want to use it as steamer, forget it, it just won't do it in a normal speed. The product smells so strong even after I kept wash it several times, used hot water and detergent. I cannot imagine to use it making rice. I want to return it but they said return time is past. I do not know what can I do with this piece of junk!
customer_reviews.author: VD Studio

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: This rice maker only lasted 3 months before it just stopped working all together. I do not recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl L Breedlove

customer_reviews.title: Great little rice cooker!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints about this one. The rice cooks fine in it and it doesn't take forever like some cookers do. I put in a tiny bit of olive oil like some reviewers mentioned so it doesn't stick to the bottom. If you're looking for a basic rice cooker, this is perfect. I haven't used the steamer tray yet though so no feedback there.
customer_reviews.author: jsharp02

customer_reviews.title: This got me so steamed!
customer_reviews.text: Not a big appliance, but it sure gets the job done. I no longer destroy my favorite pots burning rice. This little kitchen helper has made rice cooking a piece of cake. I have a parrot and I routinely cook for her. This usually includes rice or other grains in addition to fresh vegetables. This is also an excellent steamer so it cooks the rice and then steams the vegetables. Lovely! I think I'll find all kinds other uses for it. I recommend this to people who only need to cook enough rice for 4 adults or a hungry parrot for a week.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Rattigan

customer_reviews.title: and this works just fine! Fast
customer_reviews.text: A decent rice cooker is a home staple for me, and this works just fine! Fast, very little spitting, fluffy rice without anything stuck to the cooker, easy to clean. The cord is a bit short for a kitchen with few outlets, but that also means that you don't worry about twisting and breaking during storage. The classic plastic paddle and measuring cup are as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Leigh

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for — avoid this thing!
customer_reviews.text: As others have said, rice on the bottom is burned, the rest is mushy, and it spits all over the counter while cooking. Steaming container is too small for anything other than a single serving and takes forever to start steaming. Debating the hassle of returning vs the convenience of tossing it out right now as we shop for a decent replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Eric M

customer_reviews.title: Steam basket is shorter than previously sold.
customer_reviews.text: I used to have this exact rice cooker which was old and scratched. So I wanted to replace it with a new one. Unfortunately I got rid of the old one first. Those sold currently do not have the same steam basket. The old steam basket was bit taller. The new steam basket is too small and I don’t use it much. I have included a photo of the new steam basket. You can see the difference if you compare it with the picture on amazon. The seller still use a picture of the old steam basket for advertising.
customer_reviews.author: hema i.

customer_reviews.title: I like it after a few problems
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are no help on the measurements. and it includes a measuring cup that isnt standard (instructions stress that it isnt a normal measurement standard. Come on Oster! You are an old company and shouldnt rely on gimmics like that. Of course I lost the cup after a few days, but my rice hadnt turned out right anyway..... Now i dont measure, just pour some rice in then add water to approx 1/2 inch over the top of the rice, and its perfect everytime. The steamer works well also.
customer_reviews.author: Kaye T.

customer_reviews.title: works great
customer_reviews.text: I live at high altitude and was never able to cook good rice in a saucepan on the stove here -- it either didn't cook completely or ended up getting burned on the bottom. With this machine, it comes out perfect every time. One caveat: although this claims to be a 6-cup rice marker, I think it will overflow if you put that much in it. I've been making 4 cups at a time and haven't had any serious problems. Sometimes a little bubbling out of the steam escape hole in the lid, but not exploding all over the countertop.
customer_reviews.author: pondscum

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed in this rice cooker because of the poor steam ...
customer_reviews.text: I was very disappointed in this rice cooker because of the poor steam emissions design. It spewed particles in the steam all around the cooker. In order to use it I had to make sure I had an adequate amount of paper towels around it to catch the mess. I wound up giving it away and ordered a different one which I love.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy G. Coomes

customer_reviews.title: Rice never comes out right
customer_reviews.text: This product is very easy to clean. However, my rice never comes out right (and I measure like it suggests) but it always comes out sticky or too dry. It is possible it is not the machine and I just can't make rice. I thought it would make foolproof rice but I do better using the stovetop or microwave.
customer_reviews.author: Kelley WIlson

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I am so happy with this ricer. I had one but when I moved, I gave it to my son. He loves his. So, I am replacing my old one with this upgraded one that is also a vegetable steamer. I love it!! I love vegies that are steamed so this one is great for my family.
customer_reviews.author: Carrie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Automatic Rice Cooker and Steamer!
customer_reviews.text: I love this automatic rice cooker! I used it within minutes after receiving it and washing the removable rice pot, steamer tray, lid and rice spoon (included). It's easy to use, cooked my brown rice to the perfect texture and steamed the green beans I put in the steamer 10 minutes prior to the rice being done (I actually read the directions) to perfection! I highly recommend it! ps ... it's also very easy to clean ... just make sure you use the rice spoon provided (or some kind of plastic spoon) on the removable rice pot and not a metal spoon.
customer_reviews.author: DFA991

customer_reviews.title: Super easy
customer_reviews.text: Super easy, personal rice maker. I make a lot of meals with a rice base and had burnt enough rice after forgetting about it on the stove so I bought this after my roommate and girlfriend both recommended it. Havent looked back, its so easy to use, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Katharine Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Not a good product...
customer_reviews.text: I'm very surprised this product is receiving good reviews. I tried making Jasmine rice two times and both times I ended up with mushy, over-cooked rice. The first time I didn't rinse the rice and the second time I did, to no avail. This is one of the few purchases I have ever sent back since I've been shopping with Amazon since 1999. Do yourself a favor and buy a pressure cooker as you get more for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Duke

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done.
customer_reviews.text: Very simple design. 3 settings, cook, keep warm, and off. The keep warm setting is too hot so I suggest storing what ever rice you don't eat quickly. It has been several months and it's working fine. The metal pot is dinged up from washing and dropping it. Works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Romy Gutierrez

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't sure I needed this, now I don't cook rice any other way
customer_reviews.text: I went back and forth about whether I needed a rice cooker or not. I mean how hard is it to cook rice. But this thing is fool-proof and I no longer make rice on the stovetop anymore. As long as you keep to the recommended measurements this rice cooker will put out perfect rice every time. It is small so it doesn't take up much room in my tiny kitchen. Leaves my attention free to focus on what I am serving with my perfect rice.
customer_reviews.author: NM Cindy

customer_reviews.title: after 14 months it is broken
customer_reviews.text: after 14 months it is broken. (2019. july - 2020 sep). When you cook rice, it will automatically switch to warm quickly but the rice still raw........... I had an Aroma rice cooker before I bought Oster, they are cheap but they only able to use 1-2 years only, and they had this same problem. so I guess this time I should buy an expensive one??
customer_reviews.author: hy l

customer_reviews.title: It's an ok.
customer_reviews.text: This a really good if you can be in the vicinity when making rice. The "keep warm" function had burnt the bottom of the rice so I usually set it and then make a meal that I will use rice for at the same time or after a several minutes.
customer_reviews.author: MrGreentree

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and makes very good rice
customer_reviews.text: I got one for my son a year or so ago that I used a few times. He is going to move out and take it with him so I got one for me. Very easy to use and makes very good rice. A little rice does stick at the bottom but not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Love Amazon

customer_reviews.title: 4 cup MAX! Not 6 cups
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than thought.. Doesnt make 6 cups! Only 4.. but good enough i guess! I didnt read description of 3 cup dry 6 cup cooked.. also smelled a burning when first use.. and a lil smoke.. hope is normal.. cooked rice good enough to eat
customer_reviews.author: Bren Ja

customer_reviews.title: My meal was ruined
customer_reviews.text: It’s very cheap, but it doesn’t make good rice. When it stops, the rice is still not fully cooked. And I wanted to add more water and cook it more, and it won’t even turn on. My meal was completely ruined.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: I like that the insert is nonstick and can be put ...
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker works well. The ric will brown on the bottom if left on "keep warm". I have never had one before so I don't know if this is typical. The "cup" measurement is actually 3/4 cups of rice, and the instructions explicitly state to not use more than 3 of their cups, so I am not sure you will actually get 6 cups of rice at full volume. I like that the insert is nonstick and can be put into the dishwasher. I like that vegetables can be steams while the rice is cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie A. Scaggs

customer_reviews.title: Great rice cooker - but I was surprised how small it is!  Very Small
customer_reviews.text: This rice cooker is half the size of the one I had before. I should have researched the size better before I purchased it - but it will work fine for a small group.
customer_reviews.author: Mid Columbia Insulation LLC

product_meta.title: Oster 6-Cup Rice Cooker with Steam Tray, Black (CKSTRCMS65)
product_meta.description: Color:BlackMake perfectly cooked white or brown rice, steamed veggies, and more with the Oster 6-Cup Rice Cooker with Steam Tray. This 6-cup rice cooker features convenient one-touch operation, an auto shut-off feature, and an automatic keep warm setting to keep food at the optimal temperature until you're ready to eat. In addition to cooking rice, the rice maker also lets you easily prepare steamed veggies or fish with the included steaming basket. A tempered glass lid with steam vent ensures quick, thorough cooking while preventing excess moisture accumulation, and the nonstick inner pot is removable for easy cleanup. The rice pot comes with a steaming tray, measuring cup, and ladle.
feature_bullets: Holds 3 cups of dry rice and prepares up to 6 cups of cooked rice
Easy, one-touch operation: start cooking with a single button push
Automatic keep warm setting keeps food at optimal serving temperature
Inner pot is removable for quick cleanup
Includes steaming basket, rice measuring cup, and ladle

NOTE: Please ensure to measure rice in the cup that comes along with the product ONLY.The rice cooker is capable of cooking up to 3 full “rice cooker” Oster measuring cups of uncooked rice, or 6 (5.33oz) Oster cups of cooked rice (IB – Using Your Rice Cooker; Note user manual below pg. 6)
NOTE: Please ensure to measure rice in the cup that comes along with the product ONLY

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars3,982 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
